page.title: 17Sport in Luddington
page.content: Sport has always played a big part in Luddington life.Presently there are two football teams in the Scunthorpe and District Saturday League and one in the Sunday League,all playing their home fixtures by the old church yard. Three years ago Luddington won the Saturday League Challenge Cup while the Sunday team,'Duffy's Dynamos',formed only two seasons ago,have won both the sixth and this season the fifth division championships. The Cricket Club has done equally as well,winning the Norman Axe Cup in 1983 and tying for top place in the Isle of Axholme Evening League Trophy last season.However they have a big problem in that they have no home pitch.Unfortunately the soccer breaks up the only playing field so much that a wicket square cannot be levelled out
